intro: Celtis occidentalis var. submembranacea, commonly known as the smoothleaf hackberry, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its smooth, light green bark and heart-shaped leaves with a smooth margin. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in early spring, followed by spherical, pale green fruits that ripen to a yellowish hue. Its leaves are typically 5–10 cm long and have a distinctive waxy texture. This variety is often found in moist, well-drained soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
